81254.name: Space Raiders (ZX Spectrum)
81254.description:
User summary:

A Space Invader clone, this game was published by Psion for Sinclair as part of the ZX Spectrum package, in order to show the machine's capabilities. Game-play is more functional than flashy, but this game would have been one of the first home computer games thousands of people will have played in their own home.

81255.name: Grand Slam
81255.description:
A card and dice tennis game.
From the rules: "Grand Slam is a cardgame where young and old can win an exciting tennis match on the kitchentable.

Preperation: Shuffle the deck of cards and place in on the table. Each player takes five cards each. Roll the dice to see who starts."

The starting player rolls the dice and depending on the outcome the serve is aimed at the forehand or backhand of the other player, or even an ace. Then it is up to the other player to return the ball by using a card from the hand which matches the forehand or backhand serve and lay it down on the table. Then the server plays a card to match the returning ball the same way.
The game is played this way until no player has a card on hand that can return the ball.
For each card a player lays down the player draws a new card.

63 Cards
1 d10
1 Scoringprotocol
Rules

81256.name: Chequered Flag
videogameversion: Chequered Flag ZX Spectrum UK edition
81256.description:
User Summary

Chequered Flag was published by Psion for Sinclair as part of the ZX Spectrum package to demonstrate the machine's capabilities. However, unlike the other games produced for this purpose, Chequered Flag is actually a good game. You can choose between three types of racing car, with different handling and characteristics, and there are 10 circuits, including real ones such as Monaco, Brands Hatch and Monza, and fantasy circuits like Saturn Sands and Micro Drive. You must manage your fuel stops, overheating, hazards such oil, glass, off-road and so on.

The only part missing is other cars. You're racing against the circuit and improving your own lap times. But that didn't detract from the thrill. To have your own racing car in your own home was fantastic. Chequered Flag did set a high standard for the commercial publishers starting out on the ZX Spectrum.

81257.name: Barmy Burgers
81257.description:
User Summary

Barmy Burgers was a very successful and fun platform game, being a clone of an arcade game BurgerTime. You move around the screen trying to knock down the ingredients to build burgers in the right order, avoiding the sausages and fried eggs chasing you. Game-play was fun but not too demanding and graphic design was basic.

Barmy Burgers is worth noting though because its success and fame epitomised the cottage industry of Spectrum games in the UK. Written by two teenagers, Gary Capewell and Gary Sewell, it was published by Blaby Computer Games, in Blaby, a small town in Leicestershire. This form of entrepreneurship sat very well with the Thatcherism of the 80s, a small company jumping up and capitalising on a new market. These small game publishers in turn hired printers, cassette duplicators, distribution, marketing, and that economic stimulus and business enterprise was a new experience for many Brits who had never tried running a business. Barmy Burgers is probably more famous for this sudden rise than for its actual game-play.

81258.name: Descent into the Underearth
81258.description:
Subtitle: An Unofficial Supplement for InSpectres

From the Introduction:

Descent into the Underearth is intended as both a light hearted take on the speculative fiction novels of the likes of Jules Verne and H.G. Wells, and as a nostalgic nod to the classic dungeon-crawl adventures from the early days of roleplaying games. Journey to the Center of the Earth meets The Vault of the Drow. Did you ever wonder why there was never a good reason for your characters to be crawling around underground (aside from the opportunity to commit murder and mayhem away from prying eyes)? Well now there is. Come join us in an age of scientific discovery, when the glorification of personal reputation took precedent over scientific ethics!

81259.name: The Ladder
81259.description:
From the Introduction:

The Ladder is a rules-lite roleplaying game, perfectly suitable for use with new players, and especially with younger players. This lack of complexity has also seen The Ladder used successfully to run internet roleplaying games. Tasks are resolved with a single roll of a standard six-sided die. There's no addition, subtraction or multiplication required, and there are no numbers used to describe how good characters are at things. But I hope it isn't too simple! Have a look and see ...

Why is it called The Ladder? Good question. The entire task resolution system is designed on a 5-step ladder each rung denoting a level of expertise required to achieve a certain effect. If you are 'good' at driving, then we assume you achieve a task result of 'good' most of the time. Occasionally you will be forced to Step Down your success level (to Poor or Fail) or Step Up (to Expert).

videogame: Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Midway Collection 2
81260.name: Splat!
videogamehonor: 1983 Golden Joystick Best Original Game of the Year Nominee
videogamecompilation: Arcade's Greatest Hits: The Midway Collection 2
81260.description:
User Summary

In Splat!, you control a sort of spider called Zippy. You move around a maze, eating grass and plums, avoiding spikes and water. Simple enough, except that the maze itself moves around as well, and you can get trapped between a maze wall and the surrounding screen wall. As you cleared out levels, the screen then scrolled up to the next maze, and the hazards and scrolling get harder.

One nice feature was simulated speech. When you completed a level, the game actaully said ZIPPEE!!. Being able to control the Spectrum's speaker functions in this way was a novel surrpise.

Splat! had a popular reputation with Spectrum gamers because despite its basic design, it played very well and rewarded practice and patience.

81261.name: GENPEI
81261.description:
From the Introduction:

GENPEI is an unofficial supplement to Green Knight Publishing's critically acclaimed roleplaying game, King Arthur Pendragon, which will allow you to explore one of Japan's most fascinating and captivating periods of history. Founded upon the rules from King Arthur Pendragon, GENPEI's system of Traits and Passions brings your character's dramatic conflicts of honor, duty, and obligation to life. This document does not attempt to reproduce the existing rules in full, and to utilise it you will need either a copy of King Arthur Pendragon or Book of Knights, which features the basic mechanics in an abbreviated and inexpensive alternative to the main rulebook.

GENPEI is set specifically during the period leading up to and immediately following the great civil war from 1180 to 1185.

Disclaimers

King Arthur Pendragon and Book of Knights are copyright terms belonging to Green Knight Publishing. GENPEI is an unofficial gaming supplement written by Ian Young, designed to be used with the King Arthur Pendragon game system. No infringement on the copyright of either King Arthur Pendragon or Book of Knights is intended, and no profits are sought from the dissemination of this publication.

81262.name: Kid Dracula
81262.description:
Kid Dracula is a comical gothic-themed platform game released for the Game Boy by Konami in 1993. A spinoff/parody of Konami's own Castlevania series, Kid Dracula is a sequel to the 1991 Family Computer game Akumajō Special: Boku Dracula-kun (悪魔城すぺしゃる ぼくドラキュラくん, lit. "Devil's Castle Special: I'm Kid Dracula"), which was released only in Japan.

The self-proclaimed Demon Prince, Kid Dracula, has awoken from a long sleep, only to discover that the evil dinosaur-like creature Garamoth has challenged him. Kid Dracula decides to destroy Garamoth himself.

Source: Wikipedia, "Kid Dracula," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81263.description:
"My first Triominos" (or "Triominos Junior") is the children version of Triominos.
Easy to learn for children and with colorful play tokens and pennylike counters it is fun to play.

Aim of the game:
Win as many reward counters as possible by placing the right Triominos next to each other.

Setup:
Give a rack to each player (included in the game)
Place all the Triominos in a pile (called the stock) with the numbers facing down.
Every player picks 5 Triominos and puts them onto their rack.
Every player gets 4 reward counters.
A random Triominos is picked out of the pot and placed open on the table. (If it's a joker, put it back in the stock and take another one.)
Select a player who begins the game (youngest....oldest).
The rest is playing clockwise.

Gameplay:
On his turn the player tries to fit one of his Triominos to the ones already on the table. A Triominos fits if it is placed so at least one side is completely in contact with another, and all sides that stick together must match in color and figure.
If you succeed in this, you will be rewarded with a counter. If you can not, then you must pay a reward count and draw another Triominos.
Your turn is then over, and it passes on to the next player.

Game end:
When a player places his last Triominos or the stock is emptied. The player with the most counters win.

Joker:
(Using the joker is not advisable for the first playthroughs.)
The joker counts as any figure or color and can be used anywhere a normal correct Triominos could be placed.
You can replace a joker on the table, with another Triominos that fits the position. If you do so, you can add the joker to your rack, but will not earn a rewardtoken.

2nd level of play (aged 6 and upwards), to become more familiar with counting points:
In this version of the rules, you play without the reward counters.

The only differences to the above rules are, that drawing Triominos does not cost you points, and points are counted as the total value of the figures on the Triominos you have placed. The score is then tracked throughout the game. The player with the highest score wins.

References:
The only place I have been able to find a digital copy of the game was here: https://www.gebruikershandleiding.com/Goliath-triominos-my-f... - here you can also see graphics of legal placements of your Trimonos.
81263.name: My First Triominos

81264.name: Kirby's Block Ball
81264.description:
From the back of the box:

Kirby's back with fast-paced, four-way action!

It's a breakaway bash in this wild new Kirby game of Block Ball! By destroying the blocks on the screen, you clear stages and obtain powers that help in your final confrontation with King Dedede.
Paddles on all four sides of the screen make this an intense four-way action contest. Your quick reactions, and your careful use of Kirby's powers will determine your ultimate fate!


Fast-paced, block-clearing action
Four-way fun puts your skills to the test
Multiple abilities, screens and stages
Battery-backed memory saves your stage scores and game progress

videogame: Neverwinter Nights: Hordes of the Underdark
81265.name: Neverwinter Nights: Shadows of Undrentide & Hordes of the Underdark
videogamecompilation: Neverwinter Nights: Hordes of the Underdark
81265.description:
User Summary

A bundle featuring both expansions for Neverwinter Nights.

81266.name: Mickey Mouse: Magic Wands!
videogameversion: North American Game Boy (Player's Choice) edition
81266.description:
Mickey Mouse: Magic Wands!, known in Japan as Mickey Mouse V: Mahou no Stick (ミッキーマウスV 魔法のステッキ, lit. "Mickey Mouse V: The Magical Stick"), is a 1993 puzzle/action game hybrid developed and published by Kemco in Japan on December 22, 1993, while it was later published in North America by Nintendo in May 1998. It is the sixth game in Kemco's Mickey Mouse-based video games in their Crazy Castle series and the only one to be released in North America under its original title. The Japanese version was originally just a Game Boy game, while the North American version features Super Game Boy support. It was played by one player only.

The game had simple graphics, music and animation, even for its time. The companies left a million-seller logo on its box cover and label(actual sales of this game are currently unknown). After that, though, it became very obscure.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mickey Mouse: Magic Wands!," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81267.name: Zehn
81267.description:
From the Introduction:

Zehn is a role-playing game designed to help players capture the feel and essence of the stories they love to read about and watch on television. The target attempt in Zehn was to create a consistent system for playing in a world representing the fiction we enjoy, while being simultaneously simple enough for newcomers and casual players to understand yet complex enough to allow virtually any character from fiction to be created.

In order to accomplish these two feats a few things had to be done. First some simple and expansive core rules had to be invented in order to cover all the ranges of abilities character have in fiction and second those rules had to be simple enough to make sense to people trying to use them.

81268.name: Monster Max
81268.description:
Monster Max is an arcade adventure video game developed by Rare and published by Titus for the Game Boy handheld game console in late 1994. The game was written by Jon Ritman and Bernie Drummond. It is very similar in both graphics and gameplay to Ritman and Drummond's 1987 title Head over Heels.

Monster Max is part puzzle game and part platformer. The player plays as Monster Max, a guitar player whose task is to defeat the evil villain who threatens to ban all music from the world. The game is made up of isometric rooms, where the player may proceed to the next room by going through doors. All the puzzle elements reset in the room if the player re-enter it so that it is easy to retry if the player messes a puzzle up.

The objective of the game is to complete levels by collecting or destroying the objects at the end. There are three levels to each floor except the last floor where there is only one. Each level has a briefing and the player is awarded credits depending on how many lives they finish the level with and if they collected any bonus items on the way. To advance to the next floor the player must acquire a certain amount of credits.

There is no automatic saving in Monster Max; rather, there are passwords which the player may use to restart at the point the game was left. While the The Legend of Zelda game The Legend of Zelda: Link's Awakening used a battery inside the small Game Boy cartridge, as did others prior to the release of Monster Max, the additional cost of integrating a battery save was most likely prohibitive for the publisher.

Source: Wikipedia, "Monster Max," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81269.name: Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves
81269.description:
From the back of the box:

England is in turmoil!
While King Richard the Lion-Hearted is off fighting the Crusades in Jerusalem, the relentlessly greedy Sheriff of Nottingham rises to power by running roughshod over the poor folk of Britain.
Now you are Robin Hood: Prince of Thieves, the only man with enough cunning, agility and courage to combat the Sheriff and his evil witch, Morianna.
First, you must battle cut-throat guards and escape the Saracen dungeon where you, your friend, Peter Dubois, and your new companion, the mysterious, but loyal, Azeem, are held prisoners of the Crusades.
Back in England, you'll explore the treacherous Sherwood Forest where you'll muster your band: Little John, Friar Tuck and Will Scarlett. But remember, they will only follow you if you prove yourself worth enough to lead them, rescue the lovely Maid Marian and free England from tyranny.

81270.name: Fort Zombie
81270.description:
Source: The Game Website.

You're trapped in a small town with a whole city of zombies headed your way! When they get there, will you be ready to fend them off?
- Choose a stronghold.
- Get help.
- Find food.
- Secure weapons.
- Hold back the tide of undead.
- Try and survive to see the dawn.

81271.name: Urban Dead
81271.description:
Urban Dead is a Free To Play HTML/text-based massively multiplayer online role-playing game created by Kevan Davis. Set in a quarantined region of the fictional city of Malton, it deals with the aftermath of a zombie outbreak. Players enter the game either as a survivor or a zombie, each with different abilities and limitations. Survivors become zombies when they are killed, while zombies can be "revivified" with appropriate technology, returning to life as a survivor - any character played for long will thus spend some time alive and some as a zombie. There are no non-player characters in the game: all survivors and zombies are controlled by players.

Urban Dead went live in July 2005.

Source: Wikipedia, "Urban Dead", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81272.name: Aventurischer Almanach
81272.description: The Aventurischer Almanach is an addendum to Aventurien: Das Lexikon des Schwarzen Auges. It contains new entries, a timetable of 28 Hal, an index of personalities and a product overview.

81273.name: You: the RPG
81273.description:
From the Introduction:

In this RPG you play yourself. You'll give yourself some attributes and skills that match the way you really are. The action starts the minute you get out of bed tomorrow morning.

When you plan to get together to play, the most imaginative person among you and your friends should be the Storyteller (ST). This person will lead the rest of the players through their adventure in the land of Tomorrow. There you run into people you already know (or think you know) and you'll visit the same places you do in real life. The mysteries, action and adventure of Tomorrow, however, are always anything but ordinary.

In order to play this game you'll need a ten-sided die (called a d10) and a few sheets of paper. Oh yeah, and you'll need a lot of imagination.

81275.name: L.A.F.F.S.
81275.description:
Which stands for: Ludicrous Action/Fast-n-Free System

From the Introduction:

L.A.F.F.S. is a comedy RPG that borders on the absurd. Imagine a rag-tag band of bumbling elves rescuing a blonde, brain-dead hot babe of a princess from the castle of a fearful and flatulent tyrant. Maybe you'll want to rocket into the future with a spoof of your favorite sci-fi films-"May the spork be with you!" The setting and the story are up to the wildest imaginations of you and your friends. These rules for character generation and action resolution will merely help provide the laughs.

81276.name: WEM3
81276.description:
Publisher's description:

WEM3 is a pen-and-paper role-playing (RPG) game system of rules that I invented in 1997. It was invented out of a desire to simplify gameplay while maintaining a sense of realism in the gaming environment. I have been slightly modifying the core rules ever since on a very sporadic basis (this game, by far, is a somewhat low priority of mine).

I invented this RPG system independent of whatever else there was previously available and with no prior knowledge that my RPG system might have similar elements to other RPG systems available, freeware, retail, or otherwise. I have since found other RPGs (both retail and freeware) that share some similarities to my system. I do not feel that they infringe upon my RPG, and I hope the same is likewise with them.

Why the name WEM3?

A: Seriously, this is a question with no "Wow! That is deep!" sort of answer. The R.P.G. had to be called something.

81277.name: Viva la Resistance!!
81277.description:
From the introduction:

They were once innocent, like you and me. Precious children of Mother Nature, they romped, played, and killed and ate according to their natures without a care in the world.

To the Resistance, their innocent days are sources of both nostalgia and anger. Before they knew torture and cruelty, they knew only bliss, existing as part and parcel of Nature’s design. That was before they were taken.

Animals in cages. Forced to endure heinous torture. Strapped into devices meant to test their limits in endurance, strength, and resistance to pain and poison. This is done in the interest of improving life for mankind.

You and your friends take on the role of members of the Resistance, animals who’ve become cynical, jaded, and most importantly, sentient. They’ve traded their romping gaits for automatic weapons and their carefree attitudes with homicidal tendencies. They’ve been poked, prodded, and tortured all their aware lives, and now they’re fed-up and ready to party.

Free the lab animals. Kill the humans. Eff The Man. Do it all, because it’s you or them.

81278.name: Urban Myth
81278.description:
Publisher's description:

Urban Myth is a game of the near future set in the United Kingdom. Think cyberpunk but with much more subtlety, pistols where you would find SMG’s etc. This game was inspired by the Greg Mandel books written by Peter F Hamilton.

81279.name: Dark Age
81279.description:
From the introduction:

The Dark Age world is a distorted version of our own historical dark age Britain and Europe. The game is set in 610 AD but things are not quite as they were in the real historical world. Major differences include:

More towns & cities survived the departure of Rome, so there are many urban areas.
Magic is much closer to the surface.
The power balance between celts, picts & Saxons is much more balanced, no single power has a significant ascendancy.
There is growing pressure from the continent, the Byzantine empire is not content to maintain itself but is beginning to develop an expansionist bent.
The Romano-British do not rule, but their great houses occupy positions of influence within British society.
Atlantis & Lemuria/Mu were real places. Atlantis and Mu were both magically powerful cultures who fought a great war. The magical remnants of this clash, tens of thousands of years ago, still reverberate through the known world.
Mechanisms are far more advanced than the real-world of 610AD, much roman and greek technology has been maintained and developed, partly with the assistance of lemurian and atlantean lore.




User note:
This game has nothing to do with any White Wolf game/setting.

81280.name: The Haunting
81280.description:
Publisher blurb:

Critical Hits is a series of fantasy encounters created to be dropped into any existing campaign as an interesting diversion from the main storyline or played as a single evening's entertainment. This popular range of products provides DM and player alike with unusual and interesting, sometimes comical but always memorable encounters.

In The Haunting the heroes? journey is brought to an abrupt halt as a sudden dense and eerie mist descends upon the dangerous mountain road they follow. To press on further would be to invite disaster, but to camp in the open with such poor visibility is equally unappealing. As they pause to debate the way forward they see, looming in the mist, an impressive half-timbered coach house. Taking refuge in the gloomy building gets the PCs out of the inclement weather but into a world of mysteries and danger. Can the party discover the dark secrets of the Eagle's Nest, or must the ghosts that haunt the inn linger in torment further?

In this, the largest Critical Hit to date, the players are faced with the tough challenge of two overlapping storylines and the DM is treated to a complete location and a cast of thousands!

Encounter Level 5

81281.name: The Last Round
81281.description:
Publisher blurb:

A long patrol into the harsh African interior.

A grueling search for a new enemy from a conflict half a world away.

A titanic struggle between good and evil.

At stake: your life and the lives the men under your command; Portuguese ambitions as a colonial power; and the power to command the very forces of nature.

There is something wrong out there. The animals are acting strangely, the natives are restless, and a legendary figure is rumored to be at large in the forests. And at just such a time, the heroes are ordered to lead a small patrol out to the border region, in what could be the first action of the Great War here in the Dark Continent!

Welcome to our main feature! Legion Publishing proudly presents the second in a series of one-shot action stories based around a classic cinema theme. Each of our Savage Features presentations is an adventure for Great White Games? Origins Award-winning Savage Worlds roleplaying game.

The Last Round takes your players into the heart of darkness, whether they make it out the other side is up to them! Leading a dwindling patrol of native soldiers across the rugged terrain of Portuguese East Africa, the heroes must face disease, exhaustion, hunger and thirst, and desertion. And things don?t get any better after breakfast!

The only way to make it home is to fight to The Last Round!

The Last Round comes complete with encounter tables to guide the GM through the patrol's encounters in the African interior, a host of wild animals to throw in the heroes' path, and a cast of ready-made characters tailored to this adventure.

81282.name: The Thing In Radley Manor
rpgissuearticle: Nuts & Bolts of the Action! System
81282.description:
Publisher blurb:

The PCs must investigate the appearance of a new supply of drugs on the streets of their home city, during which they learn of the disappearance of a young boy and strange goings on in a suburban neighborhood. Are the events somehow connected?

Using their wits, skills and (hopefully) the cooperation of a group of children in the neighborhood, the PCs must track down the perpetrators and uncover the mystery of The Thing in Radley Manor!

A complete adventure, with stats for both the d20 System (including D20 Modern) and the Action! System.

81283.name: Deadlands Dice
81283.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Howdy, Partner! Inside this pack you'll find all the dice you need - plus an additional six'er for the hootin', hollerin', sidewindin' Wild Die. The paint on these high-quality bones has been tampered to withstand the harshest conditions, from howlin' desert winds to all-night gaming marathons. So roll these bones, amigo, and take your chances with us here in the Deadlands!

81284.name: Under the Moons of Zoon
81284.description:
A Sword & Planet Role-Playing Game

From the Introduction:

Under the Moons of Zoon has three "literary parents" whose atmosphere it tries to capture.

The first and most evidently influential parent are the "Sword and Planet" and "Planetary Romance" tales made popular by E.R. Burroughs with John Carter of Mars, and its multitude of imitators.

The second parent are dark fantasy tales of the pulp era: weird tales of alien horrors made popular by C.A. Smith and H.P. Lovecraft.

The last parent is apocalyptic and post-modern SF as exemplified by the works of M. John Harrison and Gene Wolfe.


Swashbuckling Action
Black and white moral codes
Forbidden powers and corruption
Alien horrors
True love
Civilization vs. Barbarism
Decadence and a glorious past

81286.name: The Village of Briarton (Electronic Edition)
rpgissuearticle: Nuts & Bolts of the Action! System
81286.description:
The Village of Briarton

From Humble Beginnings...Heroes Are Born

The Village of Briarton is a village setting book written for the Action! System and D20 System, and suited for use in any fantasy world.

Whether the characters need a place to rest, recuperate and refit for new adventures, the GM needs a starting point for a new campaign, or the players want a detailed locale from which their characters hail, the Village of Briarton is ready to serve.

The Village of Briarton contains everything you need to know about the colorful inhabitants, intriguing history, possible adventures and dark secrets of this seemingly peaceful farming village.

81287.name: Under the Broken Moon
81287.description:
Subtitle: The Thundarr the Barbarian Role-Playing Game

From the Introduction:

"The year 1994. From out of space comes a runaway planet, hurtling between the Earth and the Moon, unleashing cosmic destruction. Man's civilization is cast in ruin. Two thousand years later, Earth is reborn... A strange new world rises from the old: a world of savagery, super science, and sorcery. But one man bursts his bonds to fight for justice! With his companions Ookla the Mok and Princess Ariel, he pits his strength, his courage, and his fabulous Sunsword against the forces of evil. He is Thundarr, the Barbarian!"

The world of 3994 is a pretty damned primitive place. Other than the wizards and their war machines, the population of the Earth is reduced to subsisting off whatever debris is still around 2000 years after cosmic destruction cast civilization into ruins. Which brings up a good point: just how did all this stuff survive 2000 years, anyway? ...

Game mechanics adapted from the 1992 edition of Over the Edge™ (Jonathan Tweet, Robin D. Laws) by Brandon Blackmoor. Over the Edge is a great game by Atlas Games, and you should buy a copy.

81288.name: Battleground Collection 1
81288.description:
User Summary

Battleground Collection 1 is a compilation of four previously released Talonsoft titles:

Battleground 3: Waterloo (1996)
Battleground 6: Napoleon in Russia (1997)
Battleground 8: Prelude to Waterloo (1997)
Age of Sail (1996)

These represent all Napoleonic Battleground titles, in addition to Age of Sail.

81289.name: Battleground Collection 2
81289.description:
User Summary:

Battleground Collection 2 is a compilation of four previously released Battleground titles:

Battleground 2: Gettysburg (1995)
Battleground 4: Shilo (1996)
Battleground 5: Antietam (1996)
Battleground 7: Bull Run (1997)

These represent all Battleground Civil War titles but one, Battleground 9: Chickamauga, which was released the following year.

81290.name: Igels: LARP-Spieler
81290.description:
A promo card for the game. This one and Harz IV were used as giveaways to bridge the gap between release dates of the base set and the expansion set for Igels.

It is an extra weapon card that adds 4 to SAP (small animal power) in a battle.

81291.name: FLAMING GOAT!
81291.description:
User Summary:

This is one of a series of small Parsely games called Microgreens. It was inspired by a subway trip the designer had to Times Square.

There are only 3 rooms total, one of which end the game when you reach it.

The first Microgreen was the one-room game Deathworld. It was included as a bonus game in Parsely #2: Jungle Adventure.

81292.name: Austerlitz 1805
81292.description:
From back of box:

On 2nd December 1805 Napoleon achieved his greatest victory on the field of Austerlitz. You can now simulate this famous battle.

The programs allow you to command either Napoleon's French Army or General Kutusov's Austro-Russian army, against a sophisticated computer opponent. The problems faced by both armies lead to two quite distinct games for the player, each of which can be played at one of three levels of difficulty.

Different strategies can be employed by the player and the computer opponent.

The game includes a large scrolling map, infantry that can change formation, cavalry, artillery and a comprehensive system of re-organisation.

Game created by Ken Wright.

81294.name: Frontline
81294.description:
From back of box:

'Frontline' puts you at the heart of the action. You command your infantry and artillery units in the heat of battle and you are in control. Across a variety of terrain, in different theatres of war, you are in the crossfire, leading your men in diverse situations - from frontal assaults to desperate rear-guard actions. 'Frontline' is life or death at the sharp end.

SCENARIOS
Cassino -1944 - New Zealand Forces try to crack the Gustav Line.
Guadalcanal 1942 - The Japanese attempt to dislodge the US Marines in the Battle of Bloody Ridge.
Stalingrad 1943 - The last stand of XI Corps.
Pegasus Bridge 1944 - Glider borne assault on D-Day.

81295.name: SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Fireteam Bravo 3
81295.description:
SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Fireteam Bravo 3 is a video game for the PlayStation Portable handheld and the sequel to SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Fireteam Bravo 2. The game was released on February 16, 2010. Fireteam Bravo 3 features a new campaign and features like the all new online campaign co-op as well as online play supporting medals and ribbons and leaderboards. There will also be a "limitless", as described by the developers, combination of custom missions, weapons, gear, and multiple difficulty levels. The title will also support the ability to unlock these weapons and gear. It also boasts team focused gameplay that will allow new ways for players to interact, expanding on the team orientated, authentic, military experience that the franchise is famous for as well as a compelling narrative story in a cutting edge presentation.

Source: Wikipedia, "SOCOM: U.S. Navy SEALs Fireteam Bravo 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81296.description:
From the publisher:
The new colorful Smurf Carousel of Ravensburger games on the Smurf village is great! The Smurfs can not get enough of the fast gyros, so that you will get dizzy ... With skill you manage to stop the carousel and with a good memory and a little luck, help the Smurfs find their homes.
Contents: 1 roundabout carousel,
24 Schlumpf cards,
1 Instructions
Suitable for children aged from 4 years
For 2-4 players

Gameplay

Youngest player begins. Player takes spinner-karussell and makes it spin as fast as he/she can. Then he stops it with his finger. Finger now shows one smurf that you need to find. If finger is between two of them, you can spin again.
Then you can turn over one smurf house to se if that one fits or not. If it is, you keep that house, if not, you lose your turn and leave the house where it was.
When you turn over smurf girls house, you can keep it right away and spin spinner again. If you turn over a black witch card, you miss a turn and discard that card...

The rules come with some variants and some tips for beginners and for pros on how to stop the spinner.

You win by getting the most cards.
81296.name: Schlumpf Karussell

81297.description:
In 1286, Alexander III, King of Scotland, died of a fall from a horse. None of his children who survived him, the Scottish lords declared his little daughter Margaret, then aged 4, Queen of Scots. But because of his age too young, the Lords put up a regency, the Guardians of Scotland for the administration of the kingdom until Margaret was old enough to reign.

Gathered in a meeting in Edinburgh Castle, with the referee King Edward 1st of England, the major Scottish clans will have to use their influence to get the honorary title of Regent, also known as "Guardian of the kingdom."

REGENTS is a placement game / majority where he must win the points of influence in areas key to the kingdom (political, military, religious, financial and trade). The dot gain sensitivity is based on a threshold to cross in order to progress making the game very tight. In addition to playing cards "ACTION" and a charge to make the ambience of the conspiracy.
81297.name: Régents

81298.name: Cineflex
81298.description:
Publisher's description:

Cineflex is a rules-light, generic RPG system meant for handling fast-paced, cinematic action such as you find in anime, martial arts movies, and the like.

It uses very simple mechanics based on the use of 20-sided dice and a narrative bidding system (which will be explained below). To succeed, you must roll one or more of your dice less than or equal to a Target Number; the more dice you can roll, the better your chances to succeed.

Character creation is very simple, and you can fit a character's info on a 3"x5" index card. There is also an improvisational magic system that allows you to craft your character's spells as needed.

81299.name: Red Branch
81299.description:
Publisher's description:

A campaign set in mythical Ireland during its Age of Heroes. Your characters will be among the heroic warriors of the Red Branch clan, with the chance to fight beside the demigod Cuchulainn, romance beauties like Queen Maeve and Deirdre of the Sorrows, and walk the strange wild world of Faerie as the ancient pagans knew it.

The theme of the campaign is "the meaning of honor." The campaign begins before the calamitous race of Macha Fleet-foot, and is meant to end with the death of Cuchulainn. This is going to be a heroic tragedy, with epic battles and high drama, and an inevitable doom. What matters here is not survival, but how much Glory you have when you go.

81300.name: First Dividend
81300.description:
From the rules:
First Dividend comprises a pack of Cards numbered to correspond to the numbers shown against the matches or races on a pools coupon, together with three dice: one white dice marked 1,2,X, (represents a home win or first favourite, an away win or second favourite, a draw or an outsider respectively), and two standard dice (red and blue) for Greyhound racing selection.

All together using these cards and dice you have any options:
1) Treble Chance
2) Four Draws and Twelve Homes
3) Eight Results
4) Easier Six
5) Treble Chance and Home Racing
6) Lucky 7 - Jokey Points Pool
7) Racing Bingo
8) 8 Winning Jokeys
9) Win or Place Only bets
10) Forecast Bets

This game comes with coupons you use to play this weird game. You first use the dice and cards to create winning chances for teams/horses/dogs or other gambling areas. The names for the teams and such are all fictional and every game the favourites are different.

Then using the cards you try to predict winning chances to each contestant, but you can only use each card once, so you need to select carefully between the right range of winning chance. You can predict first 3 places (at races and championships) or winning team on individual matches. You can only predict only one certain place, if afraid to lose points (money).

After everyone have placed their bets (written down), according to rules for certain part (10 up above) leading player uses dices and cards to make the final results. Favourites getting better chances and so on. The 2 Joker cards in the pack act as a Act Of God in this betting game. They can remove a winner of bring a loser to front. Rules for Jokers and how to use them come with each part separately. Each part has different conditions for winning, but main idea is to collect most money at the end of each coupon (races, matches etc).

PS! Rules say that these cards for predicting the races can also used for real life races as well and refers to the product with the same name used for only gambling purpose.

81301.name: Defcon 5
81301.description:
User Summary:

Players attempt to deflect a nuclear attack upon the United States using several futuristic anti-ballistic missile systems, also known as the Strategic Defense Initiative.

Among the weapon types included are land-based chemical lasers that fire into space and can be deflected by orbiting mirrors, space-based lasers, neutral particle beam weapons, and electro-magnetic launchers that fire "smart bullets".

From the manual:

"DEFCON 5 demonstrates that however powerful or complicated computer programs become, it is, ultimately, the human hand and human mind that decides!"

81302.name: Mahanjis väktare
81302.description:
User summary

First of two campaign books focusing on the planet Lubua in the Kua system.

Contains:

Full length scenario: Att väcka Zahdak
Description of the adventure landscape Mahanji. Contains maps, characters, intrigues, relations etc.
The new creatures Dromedon and Muzhadjar
The new humanoid Sirb
Gaming info on a number of ships and new equipment.

81303.name: Chanz Spel Med Eva & Adam
81303.description:
From The Rules:
All young people have been able to follow the popular series for Adam & Eve.
But in this issue offers CP also a fun game for 2-6 players that played out in the schoolyard of Eva & Adam's school.
It is easy to play, so here's how:

Games Preparation
Before you start playing the game you need to get a die and a playing pieces to go with. As the pieces you can use spirit buttons, coins or anything you can find. Place the pieces in the start box and gear up for a tough game with many tricky choices

The game's start
In order to enter the school yard, you need to roll 1 or 6. Otherwise, you will remain in the starting box and try again next time it gets to you.
Once you are on the playground, simply put full speed toward the target. and the success of all opportunities and challenges that you must take all hazards, interesting girls and boys and the cool gang.

Chance Boxes
If you get a chance to box, you must make a choice:
You can choose to walk two steps forward (which is a bit cowardly. But surely) - or you can take a chance and beat the dice, and then applies it to be lucky, you hit a 5 or 6th, you will go 6 steps forward. but if you turn l - 4th and you'll remain, and thus have no extra steps at all.
Any chance of box is a very special place, and more about just the place you come in, you can read at the bottom of the board.

Risk Boxes
If you are on a risk-box, you must also make an important choice: You can choose to stand on a roll - or you can take the risk to die, and you may encounter real bad, switch one l st or 2nd, you stand over the three throws, but if you beat the 3rd - 6th so you do not have to be completely over.
Each risk-box is a very specific risk-spot. It is what all the boxes is a risk for places at the bottom of the board.

Rebuff
There are additional elements of risk in the game on the board are a number rebuff-boxes; you'll go to such it is revealed that you studied for a bit. You will then get back as much as it is in the box and attempt to catch up from when it's your turn next time.

Who will win?
After all the risks and chances are you or any of the players until Mon / box. No matter what the dice show you have to stay here and beat again. Turns you then 1st or 6th has been gained, otherwise you have to go back five steps, and try again the next time.

All special rules are written on to the board and can be read once you encounter them.

Winner is the first to get through the school yard with most friends.

81304.name: Ghazalis sista färd
81304.description:
user summary

Adventure where players should try to answer the call for help from the gas mine Taoan, remotely located in orbit around the planet with the same name, A rescue operation is put together in an attempt to rescue personnel and other values. The core of the operation is the cruiser Ghazali. Everything will not go as expected and the soon the players will players will meet challenges which may well cost their lives.

81305.name: Quarterback King
81305.description:
Quarterback King is a board game which unites the sport of football and the game of chess into a fun, strategic game for two players. The game pieces are set-up in a traditional football formation, on a twenty-four square by ten square checkered football field board. The object of the game, like football, is to outscore the opponent. One player manages the offensive game pieces, trying to maneuver the quarterback towards the opponent’s end zone for a score (touchdown or field goal). The other player manages the defensive game pieces, trying to capture the quarterback or prevent its advancement toward the goal line.

Pieces are moved one at a time, similar to chess, beginning with the offensive team, then alternating to the defensive team. Each game piece is assigned a specific directional pattern of movement. Once a piece is captured it is removed from the game board. If the quarterback is captured, players switch roles, with the defensive team becoming the offensive team at the point of capture and vice versa. All pieces are returned to the board and play resumes.

Scoring: A touchdown is seven points; a field goal is three points; a safety is two points.

Game Timing: The game is played in two halves or four fifteen minute quarters. Each coach is allowed three timeouts per half.

Play timing: The offensive coach has thirty seconds to move a piece. The defensive coach has fifteen seconds to make a responding move, which makes for a fast-paced and pressure packed game of strategic fun.

This description is attributed to Cort Hubbard, the game designer.

81306.name: Eon Deluxe
81306.description:
Eon Deluxe is the hardcover edition of the first edition of the Eon rules with the campaign setting book "Mundana" as well as 16 pages of extra material, much of which later found their way into the second edition of the rules.

Thus it has three page numberings, one for the rulebook, one for the "Mundana"-book and one, in roman numerals, for the additional material.

ISBN for the book is confusing. Since they have used exactly the same pages in a new binding, the ISBN printed on the title page is the same one as in Eon (1st ed. softcover).

81307.name: Toy Story: Toys Power!
81307.description:
From The Rules:

Woody is missing!
Let us run to the rescue! Nice cowboy disappeared. All toys have decided to organize a team and find a lost friend. It's difficult and dangerous job, on way awaits them a lot of surprises and bad ambushes. Take the challenge! Lean more about the disappearance and more friends will join your team, the greater the chances to find Woody and win!

To start the game
Choose a player token and place it on the "Start" field.

Objective
To collect the biggest amount of tokens - points.

Gameplay
Youngest player will start. You move by rolling the dice and collect token when moving. Every place on board has a token, until it is removed for some reason. Then the place get unactibe or contains a picture, which hold a surprise or a trap.

STOP - think about things and miss a turn
DICE+1 - Roll again to find Woody faster

+ 3 - step three extra steps

YELLOW STAR - take free token

The game has many paths to choose from. Some tokens contains special abilities like extra move or one less move, which help you to collect more token when you move around the board. When the last token has been collected, it means, that Woody now has been found and the race to the finish line now begins. While the race is on to the finish, player who lands one the DICE+1 space, can roll the dice and that to the final score or move the number rolled ahead. The first one to reach the finish will get all unused tokens next to the game board. If there aren't any left, can roll dice and take the amount of tokens from other players.

PS! Tokens with picture of Cowgirl, Woody and Buzz gives 2 points, while all the other ones 1 point.

Count the score and the one with the biggest score is the winner and hero who saved Woody!

81308.name: Getto Rocket
81308.description:
Inspired by the old Getter Robo anime series, Getto Rocket is a 2-player combination DIY board game that plays very simmilar to Chess with a slight Stratego element to it. The rules and board are printed out from a PDF (the board and 10 pieces may be purchased from the game creator.) The board is a 5 wide by 6 tall illustrated grid of squares depicting the land the two sides are battling over. Each side has 5 colourfull rocket pieces each. 3 Rockets which can move 1 space forward back or sideways, 1 Pin which can move 1 space diagonal, and 1 Bomb which is stationary. These are arranged in 1-2 rows at opposite sides of the board. Each player chooses a "home base" and the objective is to either eliminate all of your opponent's pieces, or take and hold the enemy home base for 3 consecutive turns. Any piece can eliminate any other piece by attacking first. Both are removed if the Bomb is attacked.
The game also comes with 4 different Modifier Cards, 2 of which are randomly dealt each player at the start of the game. At any you may play one of your cards to the board so that it covers any two spaces that you either occupy or are currently free. Each card effects pieces differently. Such as allowing the Rocket to move diagonally while on those two spaces.
Additionally about 1 in 10 games are packed with a special Shifter piece that is randomly swapped for one of the other pieces. The Shifter can move in any direction, can occupy the same space as another friendly unit, and can transport those friendly units with it.

81310.name: Spot Lightning Racing Game
81310.description: A car racing simulation for 2-12 players. Players advance their cars around the track by rolling 2d6, changing lanes only in designated space. If there are instructions in the space where the car ends its turn, the player must follow the directions in that space (draw cards, move forward, move backward, etc). Different sets of cards allow players to take different actions such as using a pit stop, changing lanes, advancing their car or incurring penalties. Winner is the first across the finish line after a predetermined number of laps.

81311.name: The Whispering Woodwind
81311.description:
Publisher blurb:

What do a twenty year old wrecked ship and an exquisite musical instrument have in common? You will have to catch up to a certain bard to find out but there may be other old secrets that need to be dealt with before all is done! This finely crafted adventure is geared for characters up to fourth level and easily added to any campaign setting. Players will love this adventure, which will have them guessing and keep them on their toes. Packed with vivid NPCs, The Whispering Woodwind is a chase to right that which has gone terribly wrong...and there are plenty of surprises along the way.

81313.name: They Came From Beyond Space
81313.description:
Publisher blurb:

RUN!

DON?T WALK!

THEY CAME FROM BEYOND SPACE!

As you watch the images on the big screen before you, you realize these Earthlings are more primitive than you thought, they actually fear the visitation of their planet by superior lifeforms such as yourselves!

But you have no time now to ponder the strangeness you see about you on this unfamiliar world. You have a mission to complete?the success of which affects the life of each and every Earthling on the planet.

Beset by obstacles at every turn, you must struggle against the very souls you are trying to help. If they only knew their salvation comes from Outer Space?

Welcome to our main feature! This is the third in Legion Publishing's Savage Features series and includes everything you need to run a Savage Worlds game based on the B-movies of the 1950s. Only this movie has a twist?the heroes are the alien invaders! Will the Earthlings realize they come in peace? Will the visitors? superior technology amaze or frighten? Will they succeed in their mission? The fate of the world is in their little green hands!

They Came From Beyond Space comes complete with rules for Ray Guns, little Green Men, and a cast of ready-made characters tailored to this adventure.

81315.name: Line of Fire
81315.description:
Line of Fire is a shoot 'em up video game, played from a first person perspective, and developed by Sega. The cabinet features two light guns, and a design which allows the player(s) to sit down while playing the game. It was first released in arcades in 1989 before being converted to home computers and published by US Gold in 1990. It was released on the Sega Master System in 1991, however the style of the game was changed to that of an overhead scrolling shooter. It follows a two man commando unit as they try to escape from a terrorist facility after seizing a prototype weapon. The game was criticised for lacking drama, and the home versions have "blocky" visuals, however reviewers found that there were some nice touches. The Sega Master System version was seen as disappointing.

Source: Wikipedia, "Line of Fire (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81316.name: Geografica Mundana
81316.description:
User summary:

The campaign setting book for the world of Mundana. It describes the world, countries, history, legends and myths and gives a couple of suggestions for adventures.

Inserted into the book are two maps of the central parts of Mundana.

81317.name: Fjärran riken
81317.description:
User summary:

The campaign setting book for the world of Mundana. It describes the countries that lie on the outskirts of Mundana, far away from the parts more common to campaigning.

81318.name: The Art of Heavy Gear Volume 3
81318.description:
User summary:

The third volume of The Art of Heavy Gear is 220 pages long with 452 pieces of artwork and descriptions. Artwork includes: Cover Art, Settings, Characters (including Grels), Action Scenes, Vehicles, Battleframes, Hovertanks, Flails, Fauna and Transitions from the Heavy Gear Universe.

81319.name: Jarla
81319.description:
User summary:

Jarla: Äventyr & stadskampanj describes the earldom of Jarla and the city Jarla in the kingdom of Asharien.

Also it describes an adventure campaign set in Jarla and several shorter adventure ideas.

Note: Jarl is the swedish word for Earl.

81320.name: Asharien & Soldarn
81320.description:
User summary:

A campaign module describing the two neighboring countries Asharien and Soldarn, situated on the Asharina peninsula. It contains the geography, history and religion of the region and the description of the two countries and information about playing a character from these countries.

81321.name: Consaber
81321.description:
User summary:

A campaign module describing the feodal kingdom of Consaber. A color map in A3-format is included in the book.

81322.name: Cirefalier
81322.description:
User summary:

A campaign module describing the cirefalian people and their three countries. Cirefalians have a high culture that excels in trading, medicine, economy and seafaring.

81323.name: Joris en de Draak
81323.description:
"In Joris en de Draak you play as a knight with fire and water! Be smart when heading for the great battle with the dragon. On your way you'll collect the powers of fire and water, fight duals with other knights and follow your own route. Collect a helmet, shield and sword so that you arive at the dragon in full strength. The first player to defeat the dragon is the hero and winner of the game."

The game is played on a circular board. In the middle of this board the dragon, which has to be defeated, can be found. The players start on different positions on the board and try to collect fire and water cards as well as an outfit. When a player thinks he has enough resources to fight the dragon, he may go to the middle of the board and start a battle. You have to hit the dragon three times before it is defeated. In between the hits you may return to the board to collect more cards or to expand your outfit.

Joris en de Draak is a board game based on a roller coaster of the same name which can be found in the Efteling. Therefore the game will only be sold in the Efteling as a souvenir. You can also buy the game at the webshop of the Efteling. Please note that the game is currently only available in Dutch.

81324.name: Frontier: First Encounters
81324.description:
Frontier: First Encounters is a computer video game for the IBM PC released on April 16, 1995. It is the sequel to Frontier: Elite II released in 1993, which itself is a sequel to the Elite series of games which debuted on the Acorn BBC Micro computer in 1984. The planned Amiga version of First Encounters was never completed; it had been originally slated for a summer 1995 release for the Amiga 1200, Amiga 4000, and CD32 systems. The game was created by David Braben's company, Frontier Developments, and distributed by GameTek. The game is often referred to by the shortened title of 'FFE'.

First Encounters plays much like its immediate predecessor Frontier: the game is a combination of trading, fighting and a variety of other activities like spying, bombing and a variety of other military activities; the combat ratings were also carried over from the previous games. Like Frontier, First Encounters features realistic Newtonian physics and the ability to land on planets. It has graphics that are an improvement over Frontier (the main differences being Gouraud shading and more extensive use of texture mapping) and, as well as employing the same open-ended gameplay of its predecessors, it also features a storyline concerning an alien race called the Thargoids.

In addition to these now-established tenets of the Elite series, FFE added a new element—journals that report on happenings within the known universe. These were introduced to increase the player’s sense of immersion within the game-world, and to that end the player can even be mentioned within the journals under certain circumstances.

More important than the addition of journals is the introduction of hand-coded missions that added a storyline to further increase the player’s sense of immersion within the Elite universe. Unlike the various military missions which are randomly generated, these were specifically programmed by Frontier Developments and take the player through a linear (but nonetheless interesting) series of events that starts with the “Wiccan Ware Race” and culminates in “Thargoid Missions” trilogy. Some of these missions can only be completed under specific circumstances, or with specific combat ratings. These missions take place between 3250 (the start-date of the game) and approximately 3255.

Also unique to First Encounters is the ability to earn special ships that are not available to buy. These ships are given as rewards for completing missions; the ships are the Turner-class Argent’s Quest, the Stowmaster-class fighter (which comes with the Argent’s Quest, equipped as the escape pod) and the Thargoid Warship, given to you by the Thargoids at the completion of the “Thargoid Missions”.

Source: Wikipedia, "Frontier: First Encounters," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81325.name: Sega Genesis Collection
videogamecompilation: Alex Kidd in the Enchanted Castle

81325.description:
The Sega Mega Drive Collection (known in the U.S. as the Sega Genesis Collection) is a video game compilation for the PlayStation 2 and PSP, compiled and emulated by Digital Eclipse. It includes 28 Sega Mega Drive/Genesis games from a variety of genres and ranging from 1989–96, as well as 5 unlockable classic Sega arcade games. Later a game compilation was released called Sonic's Ultimate Genesis Collection, which has almost all the same games featured in this collection, plus several more.

List of games:
Alex Kidd in the Enchanted Castle Released in 1989
Altered Beast (Genesis/Mega Drive and Arcade versions (Arcade version only on PS2), Released in 1989
Bonanza Bros. Released in 1990
Columns Released in 1990
Comix Zone Released in 1995
Decap Attack Released in 1991
Ecco the Dolphin Released in 1993
Ecco: The Tides of Time Released in 1994
Ecco Jr. Released in 1995
Flicky Released in 1991
Gain Ground Released in 1991
Golden Axe (Genesis/Mega Drive version) Released in 1989
Golden Axe II Released in 1991
Golden Axe III Released in 1993
Kid Chameleon Released in 1992
Phantasy Star II Released in 1989
Phantasy Star III: Generations of Doom Released in 1991
Phantasy Star IV: The End of the Millennium Released in 1994
Ristar Released in 1995
Shadow Dancer: The Secret of Shinobi (unavailable in the PAL version) Released in 1990
Shinobi III: Return of the Ninja Master Released in 1993
Sonic The Hedgehog Released in 1991
Sonic The Hedgehog 2 Released in 1992
Super Thunder Blade Released in 1988
Sword of Vermilion Released in 1990
Vectorman Released in 1995
Vectorman 2 Released in 1996
Virtua Fighter 2 (Genesis/Mega Drive version) Released in 1996

This collection also features more than 35 minutes of unlockable interviews from SEGA of Japan, a "museum" with facts about the games, strategy tips for each game and a set of unlockable arcade games. The PS2's unlockable arcade titles are: Altered Beast Arcade, Future Spy, Tac/Scan, Zaxxon, and Zektor. The PSP's unlockables are: Astro Blaster, Congo Bongo, Eliminator, Space Fury, and Super Zaxxon.

The European version does not include Shadow Dancer. However, it does fix previous speed problems concerning Sonic the Hedgehog which plagued the game's original PAL Mega Drive incarnation and most home console emulations of the game.

This is the first time Golden Axe III has been released in Europe and Australia and the second in North America, as it was briefly available in the U.S. on Sega's Sega Channel.
This collection marks the first appearance of the two Vectorman games on the PS2 in North America, since Sonic Gems Collection has remained unreleased Stateside on the console, with the exception of the GameCube version.

According to ToeJam & Earl Productions, they were going to include ToeJam and Earl and its sequel, ToeJam & Earl in Panic on Funkotron as well, but Sega wasn't very fond of the series, so they included Sonic the Hedgehog and its first sequel, Sonic the Hedgehog 2 as well as Flicky, Ristar, and Comix Zone instead, to make up for the emulation issues of the PlayStation 2 version of Sonic Mega Collection Plus. The reason is listed on the bottom of this section.

It is of note that the Streets of Rage trilogy is also absent from this collection in the wake of its removal from Western versions of Sonic Gems Collection.

Although mentioned in passing, the collection does not include the first Genesis Shinobi game, The Revenge of Shinobi, possibly due to copyright issues surrounding the inclusion of Spider-Man as a boss character at the end of Stage 6.

The absence of the Streets of Rage-series as well as The Revenge of Shinobi might also have to do with all those games featuring soundtracks by Yuzo Koshiro. It is especially notable because unlike Streets of Rage where he contributed the soundtracks for all three games, The Revenge of Shinobi was the only game in the Genesis-incarnations of the Shinobi-series he composed the music for, and it is the only game of that series missing from the collection. This makes licensing-issues concerning his work seem like a possible reason for leaving these games (which are among the most popular on the Sega Genesis) out.

Similarly, this collection is the first release of some Mega Drive titles, especially Phantasy Star IV, on a non-Sega console, as it has only been seen twice before – on its native Mega Drive, and in the Phantasy Star Collection on the Sega Saturn (available only in Japan).

While for the most part emulation of the games themselves have no defects, some people have noticed that sound emulation in some games is not exactly the same as their Genesis incarnations. This compilation was developed by Digital Eclipse, whose more recent compilations have become known for emulation problems. Regularly noted examples are the "Spindash" sound in Sonic the Hedgehog 2 fading out in a peculiar way, sound effects in Sonic the Hedgehog and "Columns" sounding slightly off, the special stage victory theme in the Sonic games missing, as well as no change in tempo when obtaining Power Sneakers in either game, wrong/missing death screams in Golden Axe and the sequel, a bizarre sounding Star Handle noise in Ristar and the "Victory Theme" in Phantasy Star IV not stopping the battle music. It should also be noted that Golden Axe 3 suffers badly from poor sound emulation compared to all the other games, and a few games had minor graphical modifications, such as in Sonic the Hedgehog when the screen sometimes flashes when Sonic is underwater and in Phantasy Star IV: The End of the Millennium when the screen sometimes flashes when a character was poisoned. Some of the sound effects in Altered Beast Arcade are off too, including the effect when grabbing a spirit ball power-up, hitting most enemies, and some of the beast secondary attacks (such as the Weredragon laser barrier).

Most of these errors have been fixed in a new enhanced version Sonic's Ultimate Genesis Collection for Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3, which allowing high definition playing through scaling-up and filters.

Source: Wikipedia, "http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sega_Mega_Drive_Collection,&quo...; available under the CC-BY-SA License.

RPGA Report - Here's How to Write for LFR!

81327.name: Southern Command
81327.description:
A simulation of the 1973 War between the Arabs and the Israelis, focusing on the Israeli counter-attack towards the Suez after the initial Arab invasion into the Sinai in 1973. In single player mode, the human player is always the Israelis, hotseat play allowed control of the Arab forces by a second player.

Roger Keating was the designer of this game.

(Attributed to User Summary & many hours of game play)

81328.name: Svärd & svartkonst i Chronopia
81328.description:
From the back of the book (in Swedish):

Du säger alltså att du är ett fullfjädrat skuggyngel och vet allt som är värt att veta om den beslöjade sidan av Chronopia. Jaha, du känner dessutom till världens skummaste undre värld som din egen ficka? Nå, då är det väl ingen idé att besöka Rökstaden och Grytan för att få höra lite skrönor om Ikki, den wongosiska maffian? Hoppsan, en smärre lucka på en sådär ett par sju kvadratmil i den aldrig sinande kunskapskällan... Nej, det är inget att skämmas för, tag min knotiga hand så skall jag lära dig att skilja Nemesis, de sabranska skuggmästarna, carnifexerna, de brutala stryparna, de svävande viktlösa och de ärrade gravplundrarna från de harmlösa skuggorna...

User translation:

Title: Sword & Black Arts in Chronopia

So you say you're a full-blown Shadow Fry and know everything worth knowing of the obscured parts of Chronopia. All right, you also know the world's most shady underworld like the inside of your pocket? Very well, there's no idea to visit the Smoke Town and the Cauldron to learn some tall stories about Ikki, the Wongosian mob? Oops, a minor gap of around 25 square miles in the never short-run well of knowledge... No, nothing to be ashamed of; take my bony hand and I'll teach to distinguish Nemesis; the Sabran Shadow Masters; the Carnifex; the brutal stranglers; the Weightless; and the scarred grave robbers from the harmless shadows...

81329.name: Star Trek: Strategic Operations Simulator
81329.description:
User Summary

Star Trek is a top-down space combat game based on the original Star Trek television series. You pilot the Enterprise and fight off Klingon ships with phasers and photon torpedeos while dodging the Klingon attacks. Bonus stages have you fighting against NOMAD.

81331.name: Spelarens handbok
81331.description:
User summary:

Spelarens handbok (The players handbook) is a companion book for Eon, giving the players a handy reference to the game mechanics, how to survive the game, how to create your player character and expanded inventory lists. The last part of the book explains the world Mundana, as a player character might know it, and includes hand drawn map of the continent.

81332.name: Hillsea Lido: The Seaside Management Simulator
81332.description:
The Seaside Simulator where you own a slice of the coastline! Put your business skills to the test as you endeavor to turn an empty stretch of beach into a sun drenched gold mine. You must employ cunning decision making in every aspect of the game. The positioning of your shops, the prices you charge for water sport hire, the shows you choose for your theatre and the amount you pay your staff are just a few of the many elements involved in building the finest seaside resort in the world.

Source: The Developer Website.

81333.name: Religioner: Gudarnas kamp
81333.description:
User summary:

Religioner: Gudarnas kamp (Religions - The battle of the gods) describes 26 of the religions practiced in Mundana with rules for the faithful and how to use religious artefacts.

81334.name: Krigarens väg
81334.description: User summary: Krigarens väg (Way of the warrior) introduces several new professions as a warrior and new equipment (weapons, shields and armor). Rules are expanded on martial arts, large scale battles, building fortifications and sieges.

Quest for Glory II: Trial by Fire
Quest for Glory III: Wages of War

videogamecompilation: Quest for Glory I: So You Want to Be a Hero
Quest for Glory II: Trial by Fire
Quest for Glory III: Wages of War
Quest for Glory IV: Shadows of Darkness
81335.description:
From the back of the box:

Enthält alle vier Hit-Programme.

(Contains all four hit programs.)

- Quest for Glory I: So You Want to be a Hero
- Quest for Glory II: Trial By Fire
- Quest for Glory III: Wages of War
- Quest for Glory IV: Shadows of Darkness

81336.name: Encyclopedia of War: Ancient Battles
81336.description:
From back of box

Encyclopedia of War - Ancient Battles by Robert T Smith

Designed to recreate pitched battles in the world of antiquity, 'Ancient Battles' lets you command the armies of 'Julius Caesar', 'Alexander the Great', 'Hannibal' and 'Attila the Hun', in the great battles of the ancient world.

An 'easy to use' system allows players to design their own armies in a matter of minutes so that every game can be different. Forces can be selected from those available to any one of 24 different nations.

The game comes with a number of preset scenarios and includes comprehensive 'Historical Notes', covering Battle Notes, Warfare in the Ancient World and Army Notes.

Game Features: 1 or 2 player game, computer control of subordinate generals, hidden movement, automatic deployment, variable sized battles and map designer.

81337.name: Vapenmästaren
81337.description:
User summary:

Vapenmästaren (The weapons master) contains new professions and order for warriors, fighting styles and new weapons.

It somewhat supercedes "Krigarens väg" and is considered to be the second installment in the trilogy of books dedicated to combat and fighting in the world of Mundana/Eon. The other two books are "Riddaren" (The knight) and "Krigsherren" (The warlord).

81338.name: Victorious Boxers: Ippo's Road to Glory
videogamehonor: 2001 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee (Console)
81338.description:
User Summary

The first in a series of games in which the player simulated the boxing career of Makunouchi Ippo as orginally depicted in the manga series Hajime no Ippo.

81339.name: Riddaren
81339.description:
User summary:

Riddaren (The knight) describes the world of the knight (games, hunting, tournaments and festivities), new weapons and armor and chapters on owning land (how to govern it and how to build fortifications).

It somewhat supercedes "Krigarens väg" and is considered to be the first installment in the trilogy of books dedicated to combat and fighting in the world of Mundana/Eon. The other two books are "Vapenmästaren" (The weapons master) and "Krigsherren" (The warlord).

Indiana Jones and the Fate of Atlantis
Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade: The Graphic Adventure
Maniac Mansion: Day of the Tentacle
Zak McKracken and the Alien Mindbenders
81340.description:
User Summary

Includes all those classic adventure hits on one CD!

81341.name: Monster & varelser
81341.description:
User summary:

Monster & varelser (Monsters & Creatures) is a module describing the creatures inhabiting Mundana. One chapter is dedicated to trolls and another to horses and other beasts of burden that the players might come across.

The book is now sold out and replaced by "Monster i Mundana" (5027), "Bestialiska folk" (5045) and the yet to be released "Husdjur och bruksdjur" (intended product code 5046, release date not set as per fall 2010).

videogame: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Collectors Edition Vol. 3
Forgotten Realms: The Archives – Collection Two
81342.name: Pools of Darkness
videogamecompilation: Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Collectors Edition Vol. 3
Forgotten Realms: The Archives – Collection Two
81342.description:
From the back of the box:

...a cataclysmic conclusion to the greatest AD&D computer fantasy role-playing series ever!

First there was Pool of Radiance. Next came Curse of the Azure Bonds. Then followed Secret of the Silver Blades. Now, the epic has come full circle - Pools of Darkness takes you back to the Moonsea area for the final battle against the ultimate enemy.
Prepare yourself for the biggest adventure yet! Pools of Darkness propels you into alternate dimensions on an enourmous quest. And, it boasts a fully evolved version of the award-winning game system used throughout the series.
Transfer your characters from Secret of the Silver Blades with levels, money and items intact, or create new characters! Either way, you're in for some high-level action! Battle monsters never before encountered. Cast powerful new spells. Achieve character levels well above the 25th level!
As if this weren't enough, state-of-the-art graphics and crisp digitized sound make this a true masterpiece of the fantasy role-playing art!

81343.name: Schneeballschlacht
81343.description:
Dice rolling game for the very young, promoting the Austrian stationery manufacturer Brevillier-Urban. The players are pencils in a snowball fight against the evil eraser pirates who are hiding in their snow fort.
Each player gets the same number of snow ball tokens. Then they take turns rolling a die. On a roll of 1-5, they either place a snow ball in the catapult (depicted on the game board) with the corresponding number (depicted on the game board), or, if the catapult is already occupied, they take the snowball from that catapult. On a roll of six, they land a hit and place a snow ball in the snow fort. The first player to run out of snow balls is the winner. There is no decision making what so ever; just roll the die and see what happens.

(User summary by HilkMAN)

81344.name: Postal Fudge Pack
81344.description:
From the back of the box:

5 in 1 compilation featuring all of your favorite RWS characters such as gary Coleman, Champ, Krotchy and the Postal Babes


Postal: Classic and Uncut


As see on the Senate floor, the original atrocity that pissed off your mom in 1997. Old school style retro gameplay! Includes the Special Delivery add-on levels!


Postal 2: Share the Pain


The one that re-started it all! The Dude shows up for his first day working at RWS and hilarity ensues! Fight cops! Rage against the Man! Snuff Taliban! Buy Milk! - Guest appearance by Gary Coleman! (Includes multiplayer)


Eternal Damnation: Fan Made Game


A total conversion mod based on the Postal 2 code, plunge into a dark, seething cespool of twisted priests, insanity and ZOMBIES! Kids today are all about the Zombies...


A Week in Paradise: Fan Made Mod


Awesome modifcation that adds the swanky Apocalypse Weekend weapons to Postal 2, allows you to play the whole seven days as one long game and WAY, WAY MORE! You likey!


Extras


Floor sweepings and random items of marginal interest BECAUSE WE CARE. Warning: may include nudity and midgets with guns.

81345.name: The Powerpuff Girls: Chemical X-Traction
81345.description:
The Powerpuff Girls must battle enemies in a variety of settings in order to reclaim Chemical X and track down Mojo Jojo.

In the story mode, players can pick up objects and throw them at an enemy to decrease their opponents health meter. They can use superpowered attacks by collecting vials of Chemical X. If the player successfully defeats the enemy in two out of three rounds, they move to the next enemy location.

Players can play the story mode or can battle against a friend in a head-to-head battle.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Powerpuff Girls: Chemical X-traction", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81346.name: Alver: Förbannelsens folk
81346.description:
User summary:

Alver: Förbannelsens folk (Elves: The cursed people) details on the language, geography, culture, clothing, society and history of the elves. Elves in Mundana can be divided into six separate clans, all with different history and abilities. The book also contains new elvish weapons and professions.

81347.name: Fidget Digit
81347.description:
Sliding Puzzles Turned Into a Board Game!!

Game consists of 4 15-slide puzzles attached to the box bottom. In the top of the box there is a wheel with different solutions. When the top is placed under the bottom, the different configurations show through slots, and the players compete to make their slide puzzles match the examples. The first player to finish calls "Fidget Digit!" Each win counts 5 points.

"An exciting fun-packed game, for all age groups, with no loose parts to lose. May be played anywhere...even in a moving car, train, plane or bus."

"The object of the game is to duplicate on the sliding squares the example shown in the window alongside. To start the game, turn the dial one stop clockwise. The first player to finish calls "Fidget Digit!" From box.

81348.name: Dvärgar: Stenens söner
81348.description:
User summary:

Dvärgar: Stenens sönder (Dwarves: Sons of the stone/rock) contains information of the dwarves of Mundana, their history, religion and culture as well as the relations between the four dwarven clans and other species. Information on how to create a dwarven player character and new professions for dwarves are included.

81349.name: Fury of the Deep
81349.description:
From the publisher:

FURY OF THE DEEP is an all-new adventure for the Dragon Warriors RPG, designed for a group of 4th-6th rank characters. Beguiled into the expedition of a mercantile lord, they will find themselves on the island of Xathos, lost from civilization for more than a thousand years. At its heart lie the ruins of a massive, labyrinthine temple to mysterious, forgotten gods... and at the heart of that a treasure sought by their patron, and the key to a story of terrible vengeance.

FURY OF THE DEEP is a digital-only release: it will not be issued in printed form. It is also the first adventure set outside the territory of Ellesland, and can lead directly to several of the campaign-threads in the forthcoming supplement In From The Cold.
