Wild Talents: The Heroes of New Arcadia Episode 7
Wild Talents: The Heroes of New Arcadia Episode 8
Wild Talents: The Heroes of New Arcadia Episode 9
Wild Talents: Zombies and other Caped Cannibals playtest 3
81350.description:
From the back of the book:

SUPERHERO ROLEPLAYING IN A WORLD GONE MAD

Wild Talents is a roleplaying game built for suspenseful superpowered action. It features tremendously flexible and customizable rules for creating characters and powers based on the fan-favorite One-Roll Engine. Made famous in such acclaimed games as Godlike, Reign, and Monsters and Other Childish Things, the One-Roll Engine combines speed, detail, and danger. This is a superhero game that plays for keeps.

Wild Talents includes a deep alternate history of a world shaped by superpowered "Talents" since their first appearance in World War II, and a fascinating system for creating superheroic histories all your own.

First published in a limited edition that was sponsored directly by several hundred fans, Wild Talents returns in this Second Edition, improved after years of play and massively expanded throughout, witha ll new illustrations by Todd Shearer. Wild Talents is the game the fans demanded!

81351.name: Tiraker: Mörkrets döttrar
81351.description:
User summary:
Tiraker: Mörkrets döttrar (Tiraks: Daughters of the darkness) is a module describing the tirak species (Tiraks are Mundanas equivalent of orchs, but more civilized).

The history of the tiraks are given from a tirak perspective and rules for playing a tirak and information on tirak pirats and warriors are included.

81352.name: Drakar
81352.description:
User summary:

Drakar (Dragons) describe one of the most mythical beings in the world of fantasy RPGs. In the world of Mundana, there are both "high" dragons with their own language and abilities, and "low" dragons which are more like animals.

The book contains a compilation of famous (high) dragons, legends of the dragons and the magic of dragons.

81353.name: Vandöda & nekromanti
81353.description:
User summary:

Vandöda & nekromanti (Undead & necromancy) is the sourcebook of the dark arts. It contains information on creating a necromancer, on the different kinds of undead and cults practicing necromancy.

81355.name: Misslor
81355.description:
User summary:

Misslor is a race in Mundana that seems to be of extra-dimensional origin. They are a smallish with elfin features, but not related to the elves of Mundana. There are chapters on how to play a missla, their abilities, trade and history and customs of misslor.

This campaign book was long in writing, and mainly the brain-child of Krister Sundelin who departed Neogames after writing this book.

81356.name: Barbarer & människofolk
81356.description:
User summary:

The sourcebook describing barbarians and other primitive human tribes in Mundana. Besides presentations of several groups/tribes, their individual history, society, religion, language, mentality etc is described. Information on playing one of these tribes as well as famous persons and important places for each tribe is included.

81358.name: Bestialiska folk
81358.description:
User summary:

The sourcebook describing the non-human intelligent beings of Mundana, besides more famous races (like elves, dwarves and tiraks).

In the book 21 new races are described including centaurs, lizardmen, trolls, arachnids, gnomes.

This book is the second in the installment of "Monster & varelser" (the first being "Monster i Mundana" and the second the yet-to-be published "Vilddjur & bruksdjur"). These three books together replaces the now out-of-print "Monster & varelser".

81359.name: Greyhawk Wars
81359.description:
From the back of the box:

From the mad Malachite throne in Rauxes to the bejeweled city in Chendl in Furyondy, the Flanaess is at war! In the east, Overking Ivid V thirsts for conquest. Vatun, Great God of the North, meanwhile unites the barbarians and Fists into a fearsome force. Not to be outdone, the dread Iuz masses humanoids and fiends in the northwest. And the Scarlet Brotherhood in the south hangs over all the Flanaess, pulling the strings of war like a mad puppeteer.

Take command of the armies yourself and change the dark course of history! Between two and six players can battle, deciding the Flanaess's fate in diplomacy and war, and leading armies and heroes across two full-color maps. Muster your armies from over 300 counters, ranging from light infantry to dragons -- with your favourite demihumans and monsters as well! With over 150 cards, you can search for treasure or mercenaries and receive the gods' blessing (or curse) through special events. When the battles come -- the times that try the souls of all -- you'll want your armies backed with the wisdom contained in the 32-page history of the actual war. The boxed set also includes an easy-to-read 8-page book of rules, with optional advanced rules for hard-core wargamers.

The Flanaess awaits an heroic deliverer -- or an oppressive overlord! Which will you be?

81360.name: Alver: Sångarens ätt
81360.description:
User summary:

As the second and updated version of the sourcebook for elves in Mundana, it supercedes the now out-of-print "Alver: Förbannelsens folk".

It is much more extensive with 176 pages, which makes it the biggest supplement to Eon as of its publishing. Note also that this is the first departure from the otherwise consistent art style of the covers and interior design for Eon products.

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 2
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81361.name: Voodoo Castle
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 2
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81361.description:
Voodoo Castle was a text-based or text and graphic adventure program written by Scott Adams and his wife Alexis.

Published by Adventure International, this text-based or text and graphic (machine dependant) adventure game was one of many from Scott Adams.

The aim of the game was to wake up Count Cristo, who was lying in a coffin at the starting location in the game. In order to do so, the player needed to obtain certain items, which required overcoming certain obstacles, such as an exploding kettle and a doorway that's too small to pass through normally.

Source: Wikipedia, "Voodoo Castle (computer game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81362.name: Sorgernas brunn
81362.description:
User summary:

Sorgernas brunn (The well of sorrows) is an adventure module intended for 2-3 experienced or 4-7 inexperienced player characters. The adventure is a mystery quest where the players will confront the supernatural and it mostly takes place in Asharien.

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 2
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81363.name: The Count
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 2
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81363.description:
The Count is a text-based adventure program written by Scott Adams and published by Adventure International.

The player character has been sent to defeat the vampire Count Dracula by the local Transylvanian villagers, and must obtain and use items from around the vampire's castle in order to defeat him. Players move from location to location, picking up any objects found and using them somewhere else to solve puzzles. The interface is text-based; commands took the form of verb and noun, e.g. "Climb Tree". Movement from location to location was limited to North, South, East, West, Up and Down.

The game differs from earlier Scott Adams adventures due to the use of time. Set over three days, certain problems needed to be solved on particular days, and events would happen at particular times on certain days. The protagonist also had to avoid being attacked on the first two nights to finish the game. The player would need to replay the game several times to find the correct order of events in order to finish the game.

Source: Wikipedia, "The Count (game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 2
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81364.name: Strange Odyssey
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 2
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81364.description:
Strange Odyssey was a text-based adventure program written by Scott Adams and Neil Broome.

Published by Adventure International, this text-based adventure game was one of many from Scott Adams.

The game begins with the player stranded on a tiny asteroid in a damaged spaceship. The player must use an alien teleportation device to travel to distant worlds, collect treasure, and find the materials to repair the spacecraft.

Source: Wikipedia, "Strange Odyssey", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81365.name: De fördömdas sista hopp
81365.description: User summary: De fördömdas sista hopp (Last hope of the damned) is an adventure module intended for 3-4 experienced or 5-7 inexperienced player characters. The adventure contains secveral open ends that may result in further adventures.

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 3
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81366.name: Mystery Fun House
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 3
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81366.description:
Mystery Fun House was a text-based adventure program written by Scott Adams, "Adventure 7" in the series released by Adventure International. The game setting was a fun house that the player had to explore in order to locate a set of secret plans, solving puzzles along the way. Mystery Fun House was produced in only one week and was among the less easy games in the series.

The player of this game must navigate through a maze and a shooting gallery, charm a mermaid, and turn off a steam calliope that is so loud the player's instructions are misunderstood – a reference to the "Loud Room" in Zork I. Violent solutions to puzzles are discouraged by a gameplay feature which sees the player character ejected from the fun house by a bouncer whenever certain commands are typed.

Source: Wikipedia, "Mystery Fun House (game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81367.name: Regnsynd
81367.description:
User summary:

An adventure module focusing on a mix of classical horror and fantasy. The adventurers is pulled into the fate of a village and comes across an ancient curse, a misunderstood witch and a crazy templar. It takes place in Soldarn.

This adventure was also a part of Eon 2 box (5099).

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 3
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81368.name: Pyramid of Doom
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 3
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81368.description:
Pyramid of Doom was a text-based adventure program written by Scott Adams.

Published by Adventure International, this text-based adventure game was one of many from Scott Adams, co-written by Alvin Files.

The object of the game was to enter an Egyptian pyramid and plunder its treasures. The player must face a variety of challenges, such as an angry mummy, a purple worm, and an irate desert nomad.

Source: Wikipedia, "Pyramid of Doom", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81369.name: Katres gåtor
81369.description:
User summary:

Katres gåtor (The riddles of Katre)is the second part of the campaign "Sylfens vrede" (Wrath of the sylph), starting with "Diamantäpplet" (The diamond apple).

81370.name: Av blod komna
81370.description:
User summary:
Av blod komna (Born of blood) is the third part of the campaign "Sylfens vrede" (Wrath of the sylph), starting with "Diamantäpplet" (The diamond apple) and Katres gåtor (The riddles of Katre).

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 3
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81371.name: Ghost Town
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 3
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81371.description:
Ghost Town is a computer game developed by Adventure International and released in 1981.

The player searches a Western ghost town for treasure. In addition to the points a player receives when treasures are deposited, bonus points are awarded for doing certain deeds which may or may not be connected to finding treasure.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ghost Town (video game)", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81372.name: Atlas
81372.description:
User summary:

Atlas is the complete world setting of Mundana, the world of Eon. Atlas collects the books

Geografica Mundana
Fjärran riken
Encyclopedia Mundana

In addition to these three books, a separate booklet with maps of climat zones, trade routes, magical places and star constellations, and several loose map sheets are included in this box. Some of which are not available elsewhere.

81373.name: Eon
81373.description:
User summary:

Eon is the 3rd edition of the rules, compiled in a box. It collects the earlier published books:

Eon: Spelarens bok
Eon: Spelledarens guide
Diamantäpplet: Äventyr i Västmark

In addition to these three books, characters sheets and dice are included.

81374.name: Imperial Glory
81374.description:
From the back of the box:

Re-forge history as you control one of the five great Empires of the Napoleonic era through its political, economic, technological and military development. Command your forces in titanic battles on land and at sea. Negotiate, trade, innovate, dictate... do what it takes to build your empire.

81375.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – "A Final Unity"
81375.description:
User summary:

An adventure game where the player assumes control of the USS-Enterprise D. With the voices of all 7 main characters from Star Trek: The Next Generation, the player selects which characters to beam down to different locations, flying around the galaxy trying to resolve a number of situations. Players can also take over at tactical and engineering during real time space battles.

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 4
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81376.name: Savage Island Part One
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 4
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81376.description:
User Summary

A text adventure by Scott Adams. You are trapped on a remote island. A storm is approaching. Time to take shelter in a nearby cave!

81377.name: IFGS Fantasy Rules (6th Edition)
81377.description:
From the back cover:

"The International Fantasy Gaming Society (IFGS) is a non-profit organization created to design and run live-scale, outdoor fantasy games. Our system includes eight character classes and has mechanisms for fighting (with mock, padded weapons) and for casting spells. This book contains the rules for fantasy games, along with information about how to contact the IFGS and design your own games. We invite you to join us in an exciting organization devoted to fantasy gaming!"

user comment
also see IFGS Fantasy Rules (Revised 6th Edition)

81378.name: Star Trek: The Next Generation – Birth of the Federation
81378.description:
User summary:

A turn-based strategy game set in the Star Trek universe. The player assumes one of the main Star Trek forces (Federation, Klingon, Romulan, Ferengi, Cardassian) and tries to expand their control over the galaxy. This can be done through diplomatic negotiation, colonization, or military force. There are also turn-based tactical battles for resolving starship conflict.

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 4
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81379.name: Savage Island Part Two
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 4
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81379.description:
User Summary

A text adventure by Scott Adams. The sequel to the first Savage Island. A password from the first game is required to play the second.

You are still stuck on the island. But a mysterious code promises to reveal the island's ultimate secret.

videogame: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 4
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81380.name: The Golden Voyage
videogamecompilation: Adventure by Scott Adams: Value Pack 4
Scott Adams' Adventure Series Disk - Adventures #1-12
81380.description:
User Summary

A text adventure by Scott Adams. You must take to the seas to discover a magical cure for your sick king.

81381.name: Saigon: The Final Days
81381.description:
A later Adventure International title, Saigon: The Final Days, had as its very dark scenario the escape of a soldier from Vietnam at the end of the war. It was written by by Jyym Pearson and Robin Pearson.

A quirk in this game's input parser provided an unintentional surprise bit of morbid gameplay. At one point in the game, the player must figure out how to cross a predator-infested river. Entering the command "confess to war crimes" here would not be rejected as gibberish as one might expect, but would actually kill the player. This turned out to not be a planned feature; the parser was finding the command "swim" embedded in the phrase ("confess to war crimes"), and swimming across the river was invariably a fatal move.

The actual solution to the game was no less macabre, involving zipping oneself into a body bag to be carried out of the country by an evacuation helicopter.

Source: Wikipedia, "Adventure International", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

81382.name: The Broken Covenant of Calebais
81382.description:
From the back cover:

The Bell of Ibyn Never Tolled.

And so the covenant fell. The wondrous bell warned the mai of all dangers, or so the wizards of Calebais thought. But fifty long years ago some dark force destroyed their beautiful covenant, and its opulent halls have remained untouched ever since. Until now. Into your hands has fallen a document that hints at how to pierce the protective Veil of Riddles, and you have an opportunity denied to all wizards before you: to explore the covenant of Calebais, to loot its treasures, and to solve its mysteries. But how did Calebais fall, and does the danger lurk there even yet?

rpghonor: 2011 ENnie for Best Art, Cover - Nominee
